title: Duplicate install of Firefox
content:
Hello all!

I've started having an issue in the last few days, with apparently two separate Firefox installs. A few days ago I was greeted by a fresh, blank install of Firefox and had to set everything up and sign in as I usually would on a fresh system install. Today, however, I somehow managed to launch both of them at once (I don't know how, as I just use the UI shortcut). After closing both fully, I can now only start the "old" one via the shortcut.

OS: Bluefin / Fedora 42.20, Gnome 48.6

According to the list of flatpaks, only one is installed. Unfortunately that's roughly where my knowledge of Linux ends, so I can't troubleshoot this further. Help will be apprecciated, as I don't want to roll a die on which of these will start up every time I reboot.
creator: erazem.jurkovic

title: Firefox and streaming services
content:
Hello community,

Since the last update, I have been experiencing issues with streaming services, such as Disney+. Playback is no longer scaled correctly in full-screen mode.

During playback, the image is displayed much smaller with black borders at the top and bottom, as if Disney+ and Firefox are unable to communicate the format correctly.

I have already searched the web for this issue and have not found any articles with the same error description.

System: Win11 Pro, everything is up to date, WIN resolution: 3440 x 1440 (125% scaling)

Attached is a screenshot with the playback in full screen mode. I have framed what is displayed.
creator: golm.fsh13

title: Read-Out Voice in Reader-Mode, doesn't switch after Translation
content:
Hi Support Community,

I wanted to share a strange finding. I’m currently learning Vietnamese and often read articles with translations to improve my comprehension. I also use Reader Mode with voice playback to practice my listening and speaking skills.

Today, I accidentally pressed Play after translating a news article — and to my surprise, a Vietnamese voice started reading the English text aloud! I tried changing the voice settings, but it seems the model is stuck (Standard = Vietnamese). And it can be fun, listening to that Viet voice trying to pronounce English words, but in the end, it's of no use. I would rather prefer a matching englisch voice modell, in case I should decide to listen to the translated text, one day.

It’s not a big issue, but I thought this might be something worth passing along to the development team.

Thanks in advance!
creator: doneka355

title: sessionstore-logs and sessionstore-backups files
content:
Hello ~ Re. On Macbook Pro, I messed up all sessionstore folders and files. 

After a recent Firefox crash (maybe due to repeated bad connections and using a VPV in China), I lost all my previous tabs (more than 100) and I also didn't see the "Restore previous session" in History.

I was able to find 'previous.jsonlz4' (and other *.jsonlz4) files on my October 11 Time Machine backup. However, after replacing, renaming, deleting various *.jsonlz4 files, Firefox, after reopening it, disregards any changes (deletions or new tabs) i made on the my last session, and return to the October 11 situation. I know i messed things up (see attached screenshot), but how can i clean that mess?

Thanks, Amos
creator: amos654
